summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 regarding a grand jury subpoena to Southwest Airlines. Southwest's legal counsel responds, stating they have produced responsive flight records from their CIRRUS database but were unable to locate records for Ghislaine Maxwell. The document highlights the ongoing investigation into Maxwell and the limitations of airline record retention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of a grand jury subpoena for travel records from Southwest Airlines. Also referenced by an alias, Ghislaine Borgerson.

events.title: Southwest Airlines Responds to Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: A Southwest Airlines legal representative sends correspondence stating they have produced documents responsive to a grand jury subpoena from their CIRRUS database, but were unable to locate records for Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: Southwest Airlines was served with a grand jury subpoena related to Ghislaine Maxwell.
Southwest produced responsive documents from its CIRRUS flight database, bates numbered SWA000001 to SWA000008.
Southwest was unable to locate any travel records for Ghislaine Maxwell (also known as Ghislaine Borgerson).
Southwest's record retention policy for travel records only goes back 10 years, so they would not have records prior to January 28, 2010.
The correspondence includes an executed Declaration of Custodian of Records.
